{{infobox character | people=[[Númenóreans|Númenórean]] | name=Vardilmë | image= | caption= | pronun= | othernames= | titles= | position= | location=[[Númenor]] | affiliation= | language=[[Adûnaic]], [[Sindarin]] and [[Quenya]] | birth={{SA|203}} | birthlocation= | rule= | death= | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor= | house=[[House of Elros]] | parentage=[[Vardamir]] | siblings=[[Tar-Amandil|Amandil]], [[Aulendil (son of Vardamir)|Aulendil]] and [[Nolondil]] | spouse= | children= | gender=Female | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Vardilmë''' was the second child and only daughter of [[Vardamir|Vardamir Nólimon]], heir to [[Elros|Elros Tar-Minyatur]], first [[King of Númenor]]. Her older brother took up the [[Sceptre]] as [[Tar-Amandil]]. Almost nothing is known of her life.{{UT|earlier}} ==Etymology== ''Vardilmë'' is a [[Quenya]] name. Its meaning is not glossed, but Helge Fauskanger suggests it means "Varda-friend" and is a contraction of *''Vardandilme'' with ''-(n)dilme'' as the feminine form of ''-(n)dil'' ("friend", "lover", "devoted to").{{webcite|author=[[Helge Fauskanger]]|articleurl=http://folk.uib.no/hnohf/quen-eng.htm|articlename=Vardilme|website=Quettyparma Quenyallo}}{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://www.eldamo.org/content/words/word-921529321.html|articlename=Q.
